Yes, many medical schools have started using virtual reality technology to enhance their educational programs. Some examples of medical schools and organizations that are currently using virtual reality solutions for training and simulations include:

1. Case Western Reserve University - School of Medicine, Cleveland, Ohio
2. University of Nebraska Medical Center, Omaha, Nebraska
3. Duke University School of Medicine, Durham, North Carolina
4. University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) - David Geffen School of Medicine, Los Angeles, California
5. Medical Realities, a UK-based medical technology company

Some of these schools have used virtual reality technology for anatomy, surgery, and emergency medicine-related learning. Virtual reality simulations allow medical students to perform surgical procedures, practice and study anatomy, and gain a better understanding of human body systems.
